text: Good health and good sense are two of life's greatest blessings.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Fortune is like glass--the brighter the glitter, the more easily broken.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Beware the fury of a patient man.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The pain of the mind is worse than the pain of the body.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Better be ignorant of a matter than half know it.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: It takes a long time to bring excellence to maturity.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A hasty judgment is a first step to recantation.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: You cannot put the same shoe on every foot.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Never promise more than you can perform.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: No one ever lost his honor, except he who had it not.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: He who has lost honor can lose nothing more.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Where there is unity there is always victory.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The loss of a friend is the greatest of losses.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: We desire nothing so much as what we ought not to have.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Successful guilt is the bane of society.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The loss which is unknown is no loss at all.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: As men, we are all equal in the presence of death.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Count not him among your friends who will retail your privacies to the world.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Do not despise the bottom rungs in the ascent to greatness.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Treat your friend as if he might become an enemy.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: To dispute with a drunkard is to debate with an empty house.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: One ungrateful person does an injury to all needy people.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A friendship that can end never really began.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Even when the wound is healed the scar remains.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The coward calls himself cautious, the miser thrifty.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Powerful indeed is the empire of habit.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: He who helps the guilty, shares the crime.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: They do injury to the good who spares the bad.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: There is no medicine to cure hatred.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: When you confer a benefit on those worthy of it, you confer a favor on all.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Debt is the slavery of the free.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A small debt produces a debtor; a large one, an enemy.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Fortune is like glass - the brighter the glitter, the more easily broken.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Through indecision opportunity is often lost.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Danger comes on us more speedily when we treat it with contempt.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: No pleasure endures unseasoned by variety.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A rolling stone can gather no moss.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: It is better to learn late than never.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: An agreeable companion on a journey is as good as a carriage.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A pleasant companion reduces the length of the journey.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The circumstances of others seem good to us, while ours seem good to others.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Equanimity is calamity's medicine.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A small loan makes a debtor; a great one, an enemy.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Valor grows by daring, fear by holding back.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: He who conquers his wrath overcomes his greatest enemy.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: He is much to be dreaded who stands in dread of poverty.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: He who has a mind to do mischief will always find a pretense.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Each day is the scholar of yesterday.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A hasty judgment is a first step to recantation.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Hasty conclusions lead to speedy repentance.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: There is no fruit which is not bitter before it is ripe.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Tears gratify a savage nature, they do not melt it.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: He who boasts of a favor bestowed, would like it back again.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: There is no safety in regaining the favor of an enemy
author: Publilius Syrus

text: To refuse graciously is to confer a favor.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Observation, not old age, brings wisdom.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: No one reaches a high position without daring.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: If you wish to reach the highest, begin at the lowest.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A tongue prone to slander is the proof of a depraved mind.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A sly piece of good luck, which nobody knows of is delightful.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Delay is hateful, but it gives wisdom.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: That delay is our surest protection which enables us to deliberate on the merits of our intentions
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The most delightful pleasures cloy without variety.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Hasty conclusions lead to speedy repentance.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: It is not every question that deserves an answer.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The eyes start love; intimacy perfects it.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The hope of reward is the solace of labor.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: It is well to moor your bark with two anchors.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A position of dignity is more easily improved upon than acquired.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A gift in season is a double favor to the needy.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Art has a double face, of expression and illusion, just like science has a double face: the reality of error and the phantom of truth.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: An angry father is most cruel towards himself.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: To become rich is easy. Much harder is to solve the riddles of of the heart.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Union gives strength to the humble.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Have courage, or cunning, when you deal with an enemy.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A noble spirit finds a cure for injustice in forgetting it.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Agreement is made more precious by disagreement.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The poor man is ruined as soon as he begins to ape the rich.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: We tolerate without rebuke the vices with which we have grown familiar.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: He who has a mind to do mischief will always find a pretense.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: An angry man is again angry with himself when he returns to reason.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Venus yields to caresses, not to compulsion.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The eyes are not responsible when the mind does the seeing.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The eyes see not what is before them when the mind is intent on other matters.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: There is but a step between a proud man's glory and his disgrace.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: To lose a friend is the greatest of all losses.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: He who is bent on doing evil can never want occasion.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Poverty wants much but avarice, everything.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: It is a good thing to learn caution by from the misfortunes of others.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: In a heated argument we are apt to lose sight of the truth
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The prompter the refusal, the less the disappointment.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Some remedies are worse than the disease.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: You can accomplish by kindness what you cannot by force.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: It is a pitiful fortune that is not without enemies.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Practice is the best of all instructors.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: A good reputation is more valuable than money.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: You can accomplish by kindness what you cannot do by force.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: While we stop to think, we often miss out opportunity.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: To confess a fault freely is the next thing to being innocent of it.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: The wounds of conscience always leave a scar.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Practice is the supreme teacher.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Never thrust your own sickle into another's corn.
author: Publilius Syrus
